Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of Harpocrates, reclining, dipping his right hand into a globular jar. Mould-made and hollow. Traces of white coating. Red-brown Nile silt fabric with black core (over-fired) abundant mica, quartz, organics and white inclusions. Missing head.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
'Roman' parallel (Dunand 1990, no. 109). Dunand, F. 1990. Catalogue des Terres cuites gréco-romaines d’Egypte. Musée du louvre. Musée du Louvre. Département des antiquités égyptiennes. Paris.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.047) (Phase 3)
